website_summaries.verdict: This 3-pin bow sight is ideal for beginners who want to master the basics of bow targeting. The entry level price point is also difficult to ignore, so hunters can carry several to the field as spares.
pros: Includes windage and elevation marks plus a bubble level
Small 3-pin sight is neon colored for improved visibility
Solid aluminum construction, very little plastic
cons: Does not perform well in low-light situations
Limited range of adjustment for recurve bows

customer_reviews.title: Awesome inepensive bow sight!
customer_reviews.text: I had my reservations about such an inexpensive sight for my bow but was not ready to spend three times the amount for a name brand sight. First impressions are this is a high quality sight with an aluminum bracket and three highly visible sight pins. Some of the predrilled holes were a little rough and had to be cleaned out but the sight is of good quality and the fiber pins are as bright as can be. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BrycenMTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sight; Poor Packaging and NO INSTRUCTIONS!
customer_reviews.text: As far as this sight is concerned, I am very pleased with the initial results, after figuring out which screw holes to use to attach it. My complaints, however, are that it arrived loosely packed in a thin piece of bubble wrap in a larger box with one other item. It came with NO documentation or instructions. Rather lackluster for Amazon's usual high standards. After about ten arrow shots, it started to come a bit loose from the riser (PSE Nighthawk) so I applied some thread locker and reinstalled it. Hopefully that will work.
customer_reviews.author: M. MacGowan

customer_reviews.title: My son-in-law was very happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son-in-law's birthday. He was extremely happy with my gift. We live in Michigan and we have both bow and gun deer hunting seasons. He has since said that he took it to the club range and it was really amazing. He was able to focus long range and even hit targets. So, it is a high quality product that pleased him. I would recommend it other bow enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jillane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bow sight for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am a casual archery enthusiast. I picked up a bow for almost no cost, but it didn't have a sight on it. I just wanted to make the bow so I could shoot it, so I ordered this sight along with an inexpensive arrow rest. Then I went to the Scheels in our area and had them put on a peep sight. Now for about $30.00 total cost for all 3, I have a bow that actually shoots quite well. I had to fine tune the sight and arrow rest, but it was not hard at all. The included allen wrenches helped tremendously, now I just keep them in my bow case to have handy.
customer_reviews.author: pbartlett

customer_reviews.title: buy this now
customer_reviews.text: Yeah this is a nice sight. Windage and elevation marks. Bubble level. Super easy to adjust. And $20. If you looking for a bow sight than this is a winner. I'd pay $50 for this sight comfortably. Shipping was very fast as Well. From order to door step was only 3 days with free shipping. Stays zeroed. Period. I have indoor targets, so I shoot when ever I Can. And It's never moved. I've probably shot around 200 times with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good sight for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that the sight came without commercial packaging or instructions. It was crudely wrapped in bubble wrap and tape and shipped in a thin plastic envelope. On the plus side, it came with mounting screws and a set of Allen wrenches. The sight is solid, and installation was easy. Adjusting the sight was a bit tricky, but once you get it aligned, it stays put. Overall, this is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Great first sight!
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy sight fit perfectly on my Southwest Spyder recurve takedown, no modifications needed. It showed me that I could shoot far more accurately with a sight, once I got it sighted in, and is helping me develop consistency with my shooting form. You have to remind yourself to still focus on the target, NOT the pin itself--so, the pin should be slightly blurry in your sight picture. When I did that, I nailed it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Latona

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit!
customer_reviews.text: Pardon my lack of proper terminology. The holes for the screw did not line up correctly and they should always be a standard distance apart. Someone else had the same issue as me. It wasn't too far off so I forced it which caused the metal threads on the riser to fall out during shooting. Everything else seemed to be ok for the price, but this was a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: This sight is a little clunky to adjust for sighting in. Several times I was adjusting and had to loosen enough to move, then it would drop out and fall off the bow completely. Good news is it takes bumps just fine. Adjustment and fitting of pins is ok but definitely not premium or super accurate. Will take some time to get sighted in, but once there, it should hold up and do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davids

customer_reviews.title: Your basic sight.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's a good sight. I bought this to replace a sight that wouldn't adjust properly on a kids bow. I wouldn't recommend it on a decked out hunting bow that might see some abuse in the field. It's of plastic construction and could break easy. But this isn't a top of the line sight and it's not priced like one. It worked well for my needs. Easy adjustment and hit right on target. But like I said, I put this on a kids bow with a 29lb draw weight. It does have a hole to install a rheostat light if you choose to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Kdawg74Top Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and with some patience you can get this adjusted to the point of saying " Hey not a bad group!" Could consistently hit the spot I was aiming at or very close to it. Still needs some fine tuning but I know it takes a few tries to get these right on. What are you waiting for? hit that buy it now button. lol
customer_reviews.author: JohneeCarlos

customer_reviews.title: One of my best additions
customer_reviews.text: Improved accuracy instantly. 6 shots to align, sight in. I'm a amateur, but raised my confidence and accuracy in 10 minutes. Used with Hind Sight system and immediately hit 2" groups consistently. For me it's is am important as the bow.
customer_reviews.author: Kneelzsteex

customer_reviews.title: Great customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I received the 3-pin sight and one of the neon tubes was broken. After sending a photo to the company, I received a new sight within days, Great response. Can't wait to zero it in. So many ways to adjust. Far superior to my old sights.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace E. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Pin sight, not so pleased
customer_reviews.text: The mounting screws and security of the design are great...but it was useless where the signts lined up, using the manufacturer instructions. I have a Sage II, which I ended up using witout the sight at 100 feet and end up with better groups than using the site. The construction seems solid, reticules, calibration points, adjustments are secure...it's just at the wrong place by several inches. I will seek more research...I've tried it four times so far, but better eyeing down the arrow, far more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Cook Household

customer_reviews.title: 3 pin sight
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my old hoyt intruder definetly not the best of the best but at 30 yards my sight picture is much clearer and my groups are much tighter, so far they seem to be holding zero. Over all great product I would definitely get this if you don't wanna break your bank but have a nice sight
customer_reviews.author: Mrs&Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Tough and easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: It's all machined aluminum. Easy to set up, with the right Allen keys, and illuminates well without a light. I bought the light and the illumination is amazing. I would recommend it to anyone who needs a brand-free item. It's well made and I love how it doesn't really affect the weight of my bow. I have it on my recurve and compliments it well. Absolutely enjoy it. I would have liked for it to have included instructions. Otherwise, great purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great sight! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the product I got for the little money I spent. It looks very similar in quality to some other more expensive sights I've seen. The pins are very bright and easy to spot. The level is a cool bonus, easy enough adjustments. Easy installation and looks great on my 66" recurve. Would suggest to others and will be buying from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Thalgoraguitarist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value at this price
customer_reviews.text: Really unbeatable for the price. Not as precisely finished and easy to adjust as a sight 10x its cost, but very usable and a good value. The housing around the pins is plastic, which might break if you fell on it while hunting. But the frame is aluminum. Pins are quick to adjust and it's easy to add more pins. There is not second or third axis adjustment of course. The white ring is glow-in-the-dark, which was a pleasantly surprising feature. I ordered a second one as backup after I mounted the first. I paid roughly $17.
customer_reviews.author: ND589

customer_reviews.title: Cheater's solution to accurate shots
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of holding the string next to my cheek and feeling the release near my eye. Safety first...I initially bought this to keep the string further from my eyes. However, after correcting my form and posture, I'm able to hit my targets more and consistently. They're a bit on the heavy side and screws are too long where they'll reach the bows limit and be loose. I solved this by buying flat washers to make up for the gap.
customer_reviews.author: zeron-s

customer_reviews.title: This item is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Product is already coming apart and have only had it two weeks. The glue where it attaches to the screws is coming off. And the sight won’t stay tight to the bow. Not to mention the level piece fell off day two and disappeared. Not worth the money at all!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install on Samick Sage recurve bow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on my Samik Sage recurve. It feels a bit heavy. Also came with tools for u to adjust the site. Can’t wait to try it out on the range. ...I personally wish it came with some padding so that the site isn’t baring against the body of the bow. I had to cut out some orange fabric and placed them in between the site and bow to create some sort of a padding (as seen in 4th picture).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product doesn't come with instructions but that's ok.
customer_reviews.text: The sight is great for the price. Just sight in using top pin to make sure arrows are at center of target using only left, right, up down adjustment. Don't worry about hitting bulls eye, just horizontal plane at 20 yds. Don't move pin yet. Next move to 30 yds with middle pin. Move left, right, up, down, and move pin to hit bulls eye. Don't move this again. Next go to bottom pin and only move pin to hit bulls eye. Next go back to top pin and only move pin to hit bulls eye. This is the same for most 3 pin sights of this type.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Solid Item
customer_reviews.text: Those of you saying these are crap are probably too stupid to mount them. They're solid and simple, two screws to mount, easy peazy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Accurate.... if you're good.
customer_reviews.text: Having this 3-pin sights makes shooting monumentally more accurate. Adding a peep sight to your string makes you even more accurate. However, without a peep sight and using the 3-pin sight on its own take skill and consistency. As long as you shoot the EXACT same way on EVERY SHOT (way harder than it sounds if you're new to archery) then this is perfect for any recurve bow. I recommend the 5-pin version for compound hunters.
customer_reviews.author: Nate SkyWalker

customer_reviews.title: Great on compounds, not recurve
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my recurve, but a nice sight regardless. Would be super nice on a compound...which is its intended use anyway :)
customer_reviews.author: Jason W

customer_reviews.title: An excellent target bow sight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bow sight that fits perfectly on the Raging River bows. It really is universal and will mount on left or right bows, with adjustments for height, side to side windage and even has a bubble level. Fairly sturdy design with nice fluorescent colored pins. All adjustments require allen wrenches (no knurled knobs) so you do need to keep allen wrenches in your shooter's gear. Definitely a target sight as opposed to a hunting site. Great for target shooting, though
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these sights for my daughters (7&9) bows. They are the first sights they have and I couldn't be more pleased! Great quality, easy to install and use, and exactly as described. My girls are loving them. Definitely worth getting!
customer_reviews.author: LT-Mont2017

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this was not as advertised. I just got it this morning and returned it to UPS earlier today. Not only did it arrive clearly used, faded, and damaged it was also missing several pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it a lot because I shoot mostly targets, but I used it once or twice on targets and it seems to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: No instructions or mounting information
customer_reviews.text: No instructions or any paper work at all. No fiber optic light must buy additional. If you are new to archery do not buy. I looked for Manuel or mounting and using instructions on internet but nothing with this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: IDK.? maybe I got one that slipped through. After only days I notice the tru glo fiber optic through pin plastics had and were falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Roberts 🇺🇸⭐⭐⭐🗽⚖

customer_reviews.title: Easily mounted on my sage samick recurve bow. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the hobby. I recently purchased a Samick sage. I found it frustrating that I couldn't really find an aiming point. I was more of less just shooting an adjusting on the feel. I bought this and it easily mounted. I had to adjust based on my viewing point but seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Improves accuracy right away without practice
customer_reviews.text: I like to train with and without a sight, my shot is much much better with this on the bow.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lupo

customer_reviews.title: Large and nice
customer_reviews.text: for my eyes it needed a little more adjustment. it should work. first time using a site.
customer_reviews.author: grandpa steve 47

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 y.o. son's compound bow. It mounted very quickly and easily. We are still working on calibrating it, but it's definitely been a good purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Todd[home]

customer_reviews.title: Standard mount should fit most bows.
customer_reviews.text: Archery bow sight. Fits well, feels sturdy easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Marion

customer_reviews.title: Great sight for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for the money. Easy to install, easy to adjust, easy to use. The only caveat and why only 4 starts out of 5, the bubble level at the bottom of the sight wasn't glued in properly and popped off the sight after about a dozen arrows. Fortunately my wife saw it fall, otherwise I would never have found it in the grass. After a bit of superglue, better than new.
customer_reviews.author: CraigM

customer_reviews.title: Good little sight
customer_reviews.text: Very eazy to swap to left hand, but realize that you will have to pull the level off and reglue to other side. Just left it off for my 6 year old daughter. Bright pins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For Takedown Recurves
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It attaches quickly and easily to standard drilled recurve bows. The pins are easily set to distance with precise vertical and horizontal alignment. Lightweight yet sturdy, and tough enough for heavy bush hunting.
customer_reviews.author: 😶Anxious Prepper🤫

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well made for the money can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Annie L Poole

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's well built and very stable on my Sage Samick recurve bow. The sight pins are a little tedious to adjust, but once you tighten them, you shouldn't have a problem. It looks great, too- seems to be built from quality steel, and the sight pins are nice and bright. Allows for a wide range of adjustments. If you want decent sights at a bargain, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've been very happy with this sight for the past month
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner using this sight on a takedown recurve. I've been very happy with this sight for the past month. Since it's so inexpensive I'm very careful when making adjustments and handling the bow so I don't damage the sight. If you want something bullet you have to pay a lot more. If you're careful with this one, I see no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent sight. Easy to adjust the larger pieces; the pins can be a pain to adjust however, as they require a smaller tool than I currently possess. I was able to make due but it was still an inconvenience. Overall it is still worth it for the price, just don't expect the best of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Niklaus

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy Immediately Improved!
customer_reviews.text: Good product that helped improved my accuracy immediately. Easy to use and install on my bow. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Left handed people install upside down
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for the money. Worth every penny and built solid. I used it for a couple of seasons, but I recently upgraded to an IQ sight. I am a lefty, so I had to install it upside down, causing the level to be upside down.
customer_reviews.author: JT Long

customer_reviews.title: Great sight at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This sight is working great! I had read of people having problems with the sight and the level falling off of it. So far I have bumped it dropped it and my wife has knocked it over several times and everything is still in perfect working order!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent three pin sight
customer_reviews.text: This sight fit my old PSE bow perfectly. It is solid and does not move even when jostled. As for accuracy, that's up to the shooter!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just wrapped in bubble wrap
customer_reviews.text: No screws no instructions loose in with other items larger box.
customer_reviews.author: Wayward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome site and easy to use, it works perfectly on my Samick Sage 62" Takedown Recurve Bow
customer_reviews.text: Awesome site, easy to use, it works perfectly on my Samick Sage 62" Takedown Recurve Bow. I also like how it glows in the dark. Only thing is it would be nice if the screws to hold the site onto the riser can be removed by finger so that I can put it back into my travelers case.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pellegrino

customer_reviews.title: We just purchased my 11 year old daughter her first ...
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased my 11 year old daughter her first bow with the 3 pin bow sight. After watching her first target shooting session with it....all I can say is perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This site is as good as ones I've used that were twice the price. Good quality and locks down permanently until you want to move it. I have it on my bow and it is a good site. Buy this if you're looking for a great site at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Spence

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Great sight but when I revived it the fiber optics were broken
customer_reviews.author: Rickey Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Nice sights for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Once this item is set for 3 distances the pins remain accurate. It was easy to install and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: t1mb3rw0lf

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple sight
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent product for the money. I use this on my recurve bow and it had helped get the arrow on target. I haven't used it more than a few times, so I'm not sure how it will hold up, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: jacob l. mohn

customer_reviews.title: Great gear for hunting
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, had it sighted in by a range owner. He was impressed
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Moltrup

customer_reviews.title: Good for juniors
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son's bow and he likes it. Easy to use and works well for backyard fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive photographs!
customer_reviews.text: The photos in the listing make it seem like the sight comes in a brown box and comes with the screws to mount it with. IT DOES NOT! My sight came wrapped in tape and bubble wrap, with no mounting hardware at all.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett H

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and Sturdy for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to setup, and frame is aluminum and sturdy. The site itself is plastic (hard rubber?), which I imagine will break easily if banged (like in the field against a tree), but I didn't expect bulletproof for the price. Fine adjustment of the pins is a little tricky, but again, cheap! Great little sight.
customer_reviews.author: TNH

customer_reviews.title: nice sight
customer_reviews.text: as described, will be great for my daughters first hunting bow
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Fiberoptic  fragile one broken when delivered
customer_reviews.text: One of the fiberoptics was broken, the rest is great.
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Sturdy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Sturdy and accurate. Only needed top pin, used this on my bowfishing setup. But like it better than the sight on my hunting bow. May buy another. For the price, a better value than switching a sight back and forth and retuning each time.
customer_reviews.author: Guy_in_IL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and does what it is suppose to
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and does what it is suppose to. Nice glow in the dark ring. Looks professional and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Sumaya Candy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent site could be a little more solidly built. The level fell off almost immediately and I lost it. but, it works and I shoot 3-5” groups at 20 and 30 yds. Wouldn’t buy again but for the money it’s been good.
customer_reviews.author: Diane- Rochester NY

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material forsure
customer_reviews.text: Solid site for bow i have. I only use it for amatuer rodio antenna placement. Good quality material forsure. Haveno idea on the accuarcy of the product. Too darn cold out. Would reccomend the product
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for Vortex bow.
customer_reviews.text: Great update to grandsons Vortex bow, helped him get on target and interested in shooting archery instead of watching sponge bob.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This sight is exactly like the standard sight I received on my pse bow
customer_reviews.text: This sight is exactly like the standard sight I received on my pse bow. By no means is it a 100 dollar sight but it does exactly what it is meant to do. I have no complaints at this price point
customer_reviews.author: RandyJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of work.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with it. It comes with the tools needed to instal and adjust. Using it on my recurve and had it sighted for 15,25,35 yards within a couple of hours. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: and it stays put on my bow and good
customer_reviews.text: very accurate, and it stays put on my bow and good visability
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly. Exactly as described. Very happy with this purchase and it fit the bow perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: Uses 4 different screw drivers to adjust/install, and you have to secure the fiber optics and level with a hot glue gun or risk losing the parts. Other than that, it's excellent! The diameter of the glow-in-the-dark ring is about the same as a soda can.
customer_reviews.author: J. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Need more light gathering fibers.
customer_reviews.text: Quick fix for an inexpensive bow sight but the fiber optic "wires " are only sight-pin long and therefore don't collect much light. Look closely at the pictures. Still worth the price as a backup sight.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanna

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but just ok sight. would have liked to give it a better review.
customer_reviews.text: This sight is basically ok since its made of aluminum. But the level fell out after on one use on my bow. I guess the vibration was too much for the glue holding the level in place. Setup is a-little awkward to setup. But still very useful
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Yeah on a budget, great
customer_reviews.text: Solid sights, and for the price I can honestly say that they are really good!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Gimenez

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised...until...
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive sight, this is well built and easy to set up and use. Update: level bubble fell out. Not happy with the quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: nomanne

customer_reviews.title: Yee yee
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 3 star on accuracy because the bubble level is difficult to see so that is really the only downfall it is a great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Keigan

customer_reviews.title: This sight works great but it slips a lot
customer_reviews.text: This sight works great but it slips a lot. I will probably have to replace it with a better one soon. It works for now though.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Great sight for archery
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for archery! I am new to archery and this sight was very easy to install and adjust. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: AMAD

customer_reviews.title: I sure hope the bow holds up better than these two bow sights form the same company
customer_reviews.text: I'm diappointed that both of the bow sights I received with this order had damage. The returned item looks to be defective from the factory, sight pin not complete, The other sight the leveling vile had fallen off in shipmen, I was able to reglue the level vile back in place only because I wanted to use the Southwest Archery TigerShark bow I also just purchased. I sure hope the bow holds up better than these two bow sights form the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Konkel

customer_reviews.title: well constructed set up
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and well constructed for the price. My daughter dropped her bow and broke the latch on her carbon sight, so we're looking at getting something much more durable and this item looks about right.
customer_reviews.author: 808mama

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a well made sight and is perfectly functional for someone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Did not give enough range of adjustment for my recurve ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not give enough range of adjustment for my recurve bow. Went to a cross rail type with single aiming point to get more range of adjustment
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Room for more pins
customer_reviews.text: Good product added two more pins made in a 5 pin sight
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Good simple sight
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received two of the pins were broken but I got it returned and switched out no problem. Second one came in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Robison

customer_reviews.title: Better than what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than what I expected. mounted right up, fully adjustable. screws for the frame that houses the pins stripped when I took it apart to fix a pin that wouldn't slide my fault for using a 12v power drill .
customer_reviews.author: shoot first then shoot again

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to sight in the new sight yet but it was very easy to install. I am shooting a 25 year old PSE and the mounting holes lined up perfectly to.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle J

customer_reviews.title: its a night little sight for the price. when ...
customer_reviews.text: its a night little sight for the price. when i got it one of the pins fiber optic wires was broken. a little glue and it was fixed.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: but I like the looks of it and the price was
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to install it , but I like the looks of it and the price was awesome
customer_reviews.author: Tim Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that was well made. Very helpful to aim properly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ramlall

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: No directions on how to set the sight ! !
customer_reviews.author: Bladepolisher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great deal for backyard entertainment. Seems to shoot very true and was a breeze to set up.
customer_reviews.author: jarrid henderson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition, feels nice and solid
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition, feels nice and solid. PSA: this uses imperial Allen keys, be careful and don't strip the bolts by using metric ones!
customer_reviews.author: G. Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The sight arrived very quick to our house and was easy to assemble and put on my sons bow. We sighted in one pin ( as we have limited shooting distance) in less than five minutes and it has been accurate and fun for my little guy to hit the areas he is aiming for. The construction is well made and for the price is hard to beat. I would recommend this product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice site for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice site for the price... Light weight & seems to be of fairly high quality.... Bolted right on to my bow, and works well... Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great sight durable stays locked in. Only down side is the Allen screws aren’t machined very well and hard to make an Allen key fit but I was able to after a little work
customer_reviews.author: Ki Caden Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great sight
customer_reviews.text: For the money its great, the quality is very good and durable. Bolts right on and lined right up.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great sight for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Put this on an old bow I had laying around and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Henneman

customer_reviews.title: but it does the job just fine. The mounting hardware is a little loose
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, but it does the job just fine. The mounting hardware is a little loose, but that's nothing a few washers can't fix. I put it on a Martin Jaguar.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: just what we ordered put it on my sons bow ...
customer_reviews.text: just what we ordered put it on my sons bow in minutes and am excited to try it out and sight it in... when I get arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sight fit on my sons bow using original screw holes. Seem very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: waid thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for the money, aluminum and not plastic! Sturdy and easy to adjust. Has a level which helps a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Billi E.

product_meta.title: TOPOINT ARCHERY 3 Pin Bow Sight - Fiber, Brass Pin, Aluminum Machined - Right and Left Handed
product_meta.description: Details: Material:6061-T6 aluminum CNC machined Long tumble to remove any machined mark Pins material:Brass Fiber optic diameter:0.029" color:red,green Shake-test passed Level with two vertical bars Adjustable for left and right handed shooters Markings for elevation and windage
feature_bullets: Adjustable for left and right handed shooters
